item.ptxt: Use the same procedure for the RH and LH sides.
The procedure listed below is for the LH side.
A bolt without a torque specification is shown in the standard bolt chart (See page ).

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL REAR DOOR CHECK ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Apply MP grease to the sliding area of the rear door check.
When reusing a bolt labeled B:

s3.ptxt: Clean the threads of the bolt labeled B with non-residue solvent.
Apply adhesive to the threads of the bolt labeled B.

specitem.ptxt: Toyota Genuine Adhesive 1324, Three Bond 1324 or equivalent.

s2.ptxt: Install the rear door check with the 2 bolts labeled A and the bolt labeled B.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL REAR DOOR OUTSIDE MOULDING LH (w/ Outside Moulding)

atten4.ptxt: When installing the rear door outside moulding, heat the rear door panel and rear door outside moulding using a heat light.

atten3.ptxt: Do not heat the rear door panel or rear door outside moulding excessively.

s2.ptxt: Clean the rear door panel surface.

s3.ptxt: Using a heat light, heat the rear door panel surface.
Remove the double-sided tape from the rear door panel.
Wipe off any tape adhesive residue with cleaner.

s2.ptxt: Install a new rear door outside moulding.

s3.ptxt: Using a heat light, heat the rear door panel and a new rear door outside moulding.
Remove the peeling paper from the face of the rear door outside moulding.

atten4.ptxt: After removing the peeling paper, keep the exposed adhesive free from foreign matter.

s3.ptxt: Install the rear door outside moulding in the position shown in the illustration.

atten4.ptxt: Press the rear door outside moulding firmly to install it.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL REAR DOOR WEATHERSTRIP LH

s2.ptxt: Attach the 19 clips to install the rear door weatherstrip.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL REAR DOOR PANEL CUSHION

s2.ptxt: Install a new rear door panel cushion.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL REAR DOOR REAR OUTSIDE HANDLE PAD

s2.ptxt: Attach the 2 claws to install the rear door rear outside handle pad.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL REAR DOOR FRONT OUTSIDE HANDLE PAD

s2.ptxt: Attach the 2 claws to install the rear door front outside handle pad.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL REAR DOOR OUTSIDE HANDLE FRAME SUB-ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Apply MP grease to the sliding area of the rear door outside handle frame.
Using a T30 "TORX" socket wrench, install the rear door outside handle frame with the screw.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL REAR DOOR OUTSIDE HANDLE ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Install the rear door outside handle by moving it in the direction indicated by the arrow shown in the illustration.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL REAR DOOR OUTSIDE HANDLE COVER LH

s2.ptxt: Using a T30 "TORX" socket wrench, install the rear door outside handle cover with the screw.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL REAR DOOR INSIDE LOCKING CABLE ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Install the rear door inside locking cable.
Attach the 3 claws to close the cover.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL REAR DOOR LOCK REMOTE CONTROL CABLE ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Install the rear door lock remote control cable.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL REAR DOOR LOCK ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: w/ Power Door Lock:

s3.ptxt: Using a T30 "TORX" socket wrench, install the rear door lock with the 3 screws.
Connect the rear door inside locking cable and rear door lock remote control cable to the clamps.
Connect the connector.

s2.ptxt: w/o Power Door Lock:

s3.ptxt: Using a T30 "TORX" socket wrench, install the rear door lock with the 3 screws.
Connect the rear door inside locking cable and rear door lock remote control cable to the clamps.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL POWER WINDOW REGULATOR MOTOR ASSEMBLY LH (w/ Power Window)

s2.ptxt: Apply MP grease to the sliding and rotating areas of the power window regulator motor.
Using a T25 "TORX" socket wrench, install the power window regulator motor with the 3 screws.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL REAR DOOR WINDOW REGULATOR SUB-ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: w/ Power Window:

s3.ptxt: Apply MP grease to the sliding and rotating areas of the rear door power window regulator.
Temporarily install the temporary bolt to the rear door power window regulator.
Install the rear door power window regulator with the 3 bolts, and then tighten the temporary bolt.

atten3.ptxt: Be careful not to drop the rear door power window regulator as it may become damaged.

s2.ptxt: w/o Power Window:

s3.ptxt: Apply MP grease to the sliding and rotating areas of the rear door power window regulator.

atten3.ptxt: Do not apply grease to the spring of the window regulator.

s3.ptxt: Temporarily install the temporary bolt to the rear door power window regulator.
Install the rear door power window regulator with the 2 bolts, and then tighten the temporary bolt.

atten3.ptxt: Be careful not to drop the rear door power window regulator as it may become damaged.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL REAR DOOR GLASS CHANNEL FILLER

s2.ptxt: Install the rear door glass channel filler to the rear door glass as shown in the illustration.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL REAR DOOR GLASS CHANNEL SUB-ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Apply soapy water to the inside of the rear door glass channel.
Using a plastic-faced hammer, tap the rear door glass channel onto the rear door glass to install the rear door glass channel as shown in the illustration.

s-1.ptxt: REPAIR INSTRUCTION (w/ Black Out Tape)

s2.ptxt: Clean the vehicle body surface.

s3.ptxt: Using a heat light, heat the vehicle body surface.
Wipe off any tape adhesive residue with cleaner.

s2.ptxt: Installation temperature.

s3.ptxt: When the ambient temperature is below 15°C (59°F), perform the installation procedure after warming the vehicle body surface (installation surface of the door frame) and tape to between 20 and 30°C (68 and 86°F) using a heat light. When the ambient temperature is higher than 35°C (95°F), cool the vehicle body surface (installation surface of the door frame) and tape to between 20 and 30°C (68 and 86°F) prior to installation.

item.ptxt: The most appropriate temperature for installing the tape is 25°C (77°F).
When the temperature is low, the tape turns stiff and falls off easily. When the temperature is high, the tape loses elasticity.

s2.ptxt: Before installation.

s3.ptxt: Make sure any dirt on and around the vehicle body surface where the tape will be installed (installation surface of the door frame) is removed, and that the surface is smooth. If the surface is rough or dirt remains when pressing the tape onto the surface, air will be trapped under the tape and result in a poor appearance.

atten4.ptxt: Spray water on the shop floor to settle any dust.

s2.ptxt: Key points for handling the tape.

s3.ptxt: The tape bends and rolls up easily. Store the tape between flat pieces of cardboard or other similar objects and keep it dry and level.

atten3.ptxt: Do not bend the tape or leave it in a place with a high temperature.

s2.ptxt: Key points for the installation of the tape (how to use a squeegee and the installation procedure for a flat surface).

item.ptxt: Position the tape with a high level of accuracy to achieve a neat finish and to avoid peeling.
The tape cannot be reused because it deforms and will not fit after removal.

s3.ptxt: To avoid air bubbles, slightly raise the part of the tape that is going to be applied so that its adhesive surface does not touch the vehicle body while applying the tape. Tilt the squeegee 40 to 50° (for pressing forward) or 30 to 45° (for pulling) from the vehicle body surface and press with a force of 20 to 30 N (2 to 3 kgf) while moving the squeegee at a constant slow speed of 3 to 7 cm (1.2 to 2.8 in.) per second.

atten3.ptxt: Be sure to observe the specified pressing speed, force and angle of the squeegee to avoid wrinkles and air bubbles.

item.ptxt: Either angle of the squeegee (for pressing forward or for pulling) is acceptable.
Be sure to apply the tape while removing the release paper 10 to 20 mm (0.393 to 0.787 in.) from the edge of the squeegee.

s2.ptxt: Key points for the installation of the tape (how to use a squeegee and the installation procedure for hemming surfaces).

s3.ptxt: If it is difficult to press the tape, press it in several steps as shown in the illustration. Use your fingers or the padded surface of a squeegee to slowly apply the tape to the hem of the vehicle, especially for a small hem.

atten4.ptxt: When applying tape to the backside of a hem, remove the release paper and use your fingers or the padded surface of a squeegee.

s2.ptxt: Key points for the installation of the tape (how to use a squeegee and the installation procedure for corners).

s3.ptxt: Remove the release paper and apply the tape carefully with your fingers.
Before applying the tape to each corner, heat the tape using a heat light and gradually apply it to avoid wrinkles in the tape and achieve a neat finish.

s2.ptxt: Check after installation.

s3.ptxt: After completing the application, check if the tape is applied neatly. If the tape is not applied neatly, apply new tape.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL REAR OUTER BLACK OUT TAPE LH (w/ Black Out Tape)

atten4.ptxt: When installing the rear outer black out tape, heat the rear door panel and rear outer black out tape using a heat light.

atten3.ptxt: Do not heat the rear door panel or rear outer black out tape excessively.

s2.ptxt: Clean the rear door panel surface.

s3.ptxt: Using a heat light, heat the rear door panel surface.
Remove the double-sided tape from the rear door panel.
Wipe off any tape adhesive residue with cleaner.

s2.ptxt: Install a new rear outer black out tape.

s3.ptxt: Using a heat light, heat the rear door panel and a new rear outer black out tape.
Remove the peeling paper from the face of the rear outer black out tape.

atten4.ptxt: After removing the peeling paper, keep the exposed adhesive free from foreign matter.

s3.ptxt: Install the rear outer black out tape in the position shown in the illustration.

atten4.ptxt: Press the rear outer black out tape firmly to install it.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL UPPER OUTER BLACK OUT TAPE LH (w/ Black Out Tape)

atten4.ptxt: When installing the upper outer black out tape, heat the rear door panel and upper outer black out tape using a heat light.

atten3.ptxt: Do not heat the rear door panel or upper outer black out tape excessively.

s2.ptxt: Clean the rear door panel surface.

s3.ptxt: Using a heat light, heat the rear door panel surface.
Remove the double-sided tape from the rear door panel.
Wipe off any tape adhesive residue with cleaner.

s2.ptxt: Install a new upper outer black out tape.

s3.ptxt: Using a heat light, heat the rear door panel and a new upper outer black out tape.
Remove the peeling paper from the face of the upper outer black out tape.

atten4.ptxt: After removing the peeling paper, keep the exposed adhesive free from foreign matter.

s3.ptxt: Install the upper outer black out tape in the position shown in the illustration.

atten4.ptxt: Press the upper outer black out tape firmly to install it.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL FRONT OUTER BLACK OUT TAPE LH (w/ Black Out Tape)

atten4.ptxt: When installing the front outer black out tape, heat the rear door panel and front outer black out tape using a heat light.

atten3.ptxt: Do not heat the rear door panel or front outer black out tape excessively.

s2.ptxt: Clean the rear door panel surface.

s3.ptxt: Using a heat light, heat the rear door panel surface.
Remove the double-sided tape from the rear door panel.
Wipe off any tape adhesive residue with cleaner.

s2.ptxt: Install a new front outer black out tape.

s3.ptxt: Using a heat light, heat the rear door panel and a new front outer black out tape.
Remove the peeling paper from the face of the front outer black out tape.

atten4.ptxt: After removing the peeling paper, keep the exposed adhesive free from foreign matter.

s3.ptxt: Install the front outer black out tape in the position shown in the illustration.

atten4.ptxt: Press the front outer black out tape firmly to install it.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL REAR DOOR BELT MOULDING ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Attach the 5 claws to install the rear door belt moulding.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL REAR DOOR GLASS SUB-ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: w/ Power Window:

s3.ptxt: Temporarily install the rear power window regulator switch assembly with rear door armrest base panel.
Connect the cable to the negative (-) battery terminal.
Operate the rear door power window regulator so that the rear door glass can be installed.
Disconnect the cable from the negative (-) battery terminal.

atten3.ptxt: When disconnecting the cable, some systems need to be initialized after the cable is reconnected (See page ).

s3.ptxt: Remove the rear power window regulator switch assembly with rear door armrest base panel.

s2.ptxt: w/o Power Window:

s3.ptxt: Temporarily install the front door window regulator handle.
Operate the front door window regulator so that the front door glass can be installed.
Remove the front door window regulator handle.

s2.ptxt: Install the front side of the rear door glass run.
Apply MP grease to the sliding area of the rear door glass channel as shown in the illustration.
Install the rear door glass channel to the rear door power window regulator as shown in the illustration.

atten3.ptxt: Do not damage the door glass.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL REAR DOOR QUARTER WINDOW WEATHERSTRIP LH

s2.ptxt: Install the rear door quarter window weatherstrip to the rear door quarter window glass.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL REAR DOOR QUARTER WINDOW GLASS LH

s2.ptxt: Install the rear door quarter window glass.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL REAR DOOR WINDOW DIVISION BAR SUB-ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Temporarily install the temporary bolt to the rear door window division bar.
Align the rear door glass run with the rear door window division bar.
Install the rear door window division bar with the bolt and screw, and then tighten the temporary bolt.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL REAR DOOR GLASS RUN LH

s2.ptxt: Finish installing the rear door glass run.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL REAR DOOR SERVICE HOLE COVER LH

s2.ptxt: Apply new butyl tape to the rear door panel.
Pass the wire harness through a new rear door service hole cover.

Pass the rear door inside locking cable and rear door lock remote control cable through a new rear door service hole cover, and then attach the rear door service hole cover using the reference points on the rear door panel.

item.ptxt: Securely install the rear door service hole cover to prevent wrinkles and air bubbles.
There should be no wrinkles or folds after installing the rear door service hole cover.
After installing the rear door service hole cover, check the seal quality.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL REAR DOOR NO. 2 TRIM BRACKET

s2.ptxt: Install the rear door No. 2 trim bracket with the 2 screws.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL REAR DOOR INSIDE HANDLE SUB-ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Connect the rear door inside locking cable and rear door lock remote control cable to the rear door inside handle.
Attach the 2 guides as indicated by the arrow in the illustration, and then attach the claw to install the rear door inside handle.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL REAR SPEAKER ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Install a nose piece to an air riveter or hand riveter. Then insert the mandrel part of a new φ4 mm waterproof rivet into the nose piece.
Using an air riveter or hand riveter, install the speaker with 3 new rivets.

item.ptxt: Do not pry the rivet with the riveter, as this will cause damage to the riveter and mandrel.
Confirm that the rivets are seated properly against the speaker.
Do not tilt the riveter when installing the rivet to the speaker.
Do not leave any space between the rivet head and speaker.
Do not leave any space between the speaker and door. Firmly hold together the 2 items while installing the rivet.

s2.ptxt: Connect the connector.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL REAR DOOR INNER GLASS WEATHERSTRIP LH

s2.ptxt: Install the rear door inner glass weatherstrip to the rear door trim board and fold down the 5 claws in the directions indicated by the arrows in the illustration.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL REAR DOOR TRIM BOARD SUB-ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Attach the 10 clips to install the rear door trim board.
Install the screw.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL REAR POWER WINDOW REGULATOR SWITCH ASSEMBLY WITH REAR DOOR ARMREST BASE PANEL (w/ Power Window)

s2.ptxt: Connect the connector.
Attach the 2 claws and 8 clips to install the rear power window regulator switch assembly with rear door armrest base panel.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL REAR DOOR UPPER ARMREST BASE PANEL LH (w/o Power Window)

s2.ptxt: Attach the 2 claws and 8 clips to install the rear door upper armrest base panel.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL REAR DOOR WINDOW REGULATOR HANDLE ASSEMBLY (w/o Power Window)

s2.ptxt: Temporarily install the front door window regulator handle, fully close the window, and then remove the front door window regulator handle.
Install the plate and snap ring to the front door window regulator handle.
Install the front door window regulator handle to the front door window regulator as shown in the illustration.

s-1.ptxt: CONNECT CABLE TO NEGATIVE BATTERY TERMINAL (w/ Power Window)

atten3.ptxt: When disconnecting the cable, some systems need to be initialized after the cable is reconnected (See page ).
